episode_title: 105 - The One With the East German Laundry Detergent

content.description: Central Perk, all six are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you let it go? It’s not that big a deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not that big a deal? It’s amazing. Ok, you just reach in there, there’s one little maneuver, and bam, a bra right out the sleeve. All right, as far as I’m concerned, there is nothing a guy can do that even comes close. Am I right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! You guys can pee standing up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can? All right, I’m tryin’ that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, you know what blows my mind? Women can see breasts any time they want. You just look down and there they are. How you get any work done is beyond me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ok, you know what I don’t get? The way guys can do so many mean things, and then not even care.
(Long pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Multiple orgasms!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, Saturday night, the big night, date night, Saturday night, Sat-ur-day night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No plans, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not a one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not even, say, breaking up with Janice?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, right, right, shut up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, nobody likes breaking up with someone. You just gotta do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I know, but it’s just so hard, you know? I mean, you’re sitting there with her, she has no idea what’s happening, and then you finally get up the courage to do it, and there’s the horrible awkward moment when you’ve handed her the note.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why do you have to break up with her? Be a man, just stop calling.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, if you want, I’ll do it with you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, thanks, but I think she’d feel like we’re gangin’ up on her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I mean you break up with Janice and I’ll break up with Tony.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tony?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re breaking up with Tony?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know, he’s sweet, but it’s just not fun anymore, you know? I don’t know if it’s me, or his hunger strike, or, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does anybody want anything else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah, last week you had a wonderful, nutty, chocolatey kind of a cakey pie thing. (Rachel gives him a dirty look) Nothing, just, just, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s the matter? Why so scrunchy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s my father. He wants to give me a Mercedes convertible.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That guy, he burns me up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, it’s a Mercedes if I move back home. Oh, it was horrible. He called me young lady .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, I hate when my father calls me that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did he give you that whole “You’re-not-up-to-this” thing again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, yeah. Actually, I got the extended disco version, with three choruses of “You’ll never make it on your own”.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, uh-huh.
(Angela, a beautiful woman in a tight dress, enters.)

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Hi, Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My god, Angela.
(Angela takes a seat at the counter.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, being dumped by you obviously agrees with her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you gonna go over there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, yeah, no, ok, but not yet. I don’t wanna seem too eager. One Mississippi, two Mississippi, three Mississippi. That seems pretty cool. (he walks over to her) Hey, Angela.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You look good.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: That’s because I’m wearing a dress that accents my boobs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t say.
(Cut to Ross and Rachel, talking next to one of the tables.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, Rachel, what are you, uh, what’re you doing tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, big glamour night. Me and Monica at Laundorama.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you uh, you wanna hear a freaky coincidence? Guess who’s doing laundry there too?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Me. Was that not clear? Hey, why don’t, um, why don’t I just join you both, here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t you have a laundry room in your building?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, I do have a laundry room in my building, um, but there’s a… rat problem. Apparently they’re attracted to the dryer sheets, and they’re goin’ in fine, but they’re comin’ out all… fluffy. Anyway, say, sevenish?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure.
(Cut back to Joey and Angela at the counter.)

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Forget it Joey. I’m with Bob now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bob? Who the hell’s Bob?

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Bob is great. He’s smart, he’s sophisticated, and he has a real job. You, you go on three auditions a month and you call yourself an actor, but Bob…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, we were great together. And not just at the fun stuff, but like, talking too.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Yeah, well, sorry, Joe. You said let’s just be friends, so guess what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: We’re just friends.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine, fine, so, why don’t the four of us go out and have dinner together tonight? You know, as friends?

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: What four of us?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know, you and Bob, and me and my girlfriend, uh, uh, Monica.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment, Joey is there, trying to convince Monica to pose as his girlfriend. His plan is to hook Monica up with Angela’s boyfriend Bob and then take Angela back for himself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica, I’m tellin’ you, this guy is perfect for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Forget it. Not after your cousin who could belch the alphabet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on. This guy’s great. His name’s Bob. He’s Angela’s… brother. He’s smart, he’s sophisticated, and he has a real job. Me, I go on three auditions a month and call myself an actor, but Bob is…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, god help us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugly Naked Guy’s laying kitchen tile. Eww!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eww! Look, I’m asking a favor here. If I do this for her brother, maybe Angela will come back to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s going on here? You go out with tons of girls.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, but, I made a huge mistake. I never should have broken up with her. Will you help me? Please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, bye. (hangs up) Well, Monica’s not coming, it’s just gonna be me and Rachel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. Well, hold on camper, are you sure you’ve thought this thing through?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s laundry. The thinking through is minimal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s just you and Rachel, just the two of you? This is a date. You’re going on a date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nuh-uh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yuh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what’re you saying here? I should shave again, pick up some wine, what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you may wanna rethink the dirty underwear. This is basically the first time she’s gonna see your underwear—you want it to be dirty?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, and uh, the fabric softener?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok, now what is wrong with my Snuggles ? What, it says I’m a sensitive, warm kinda guy, you know, like a warm, fuzzy bear. Ok, I can pick something else up on the way.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There you go.

content.description: A fancy restaurant, Joey and Monica are there, meeting Angela and Bob, who Monica thinks is Angela’s brother.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. So what does this Bob guy look like? Is he tall? Short?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Which?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Which what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ve never met Bob, have you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but he’s…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, Joey, for all we know this guy could be horribly…
(Angela and Bob walk in. Bob is good-looking.)

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Hey, Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …horribly attractive. I’ll be shutting up now.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Phoebe are there, both ready to break up with their significant others.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where are they? Where are they?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is nice. We never do anything just the two of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s great. Maybe tomorrow we can rent a car and run over some puppies.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eww, I don’t wanna do that.
(Janice and Phoebe’s boyfriend, Tony, walk in.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here we go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, have a good break-up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, my god, I am so glad you called me. I had the most supremely awful day.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, that’s not good. Can I get an espresso and a latte over here, please?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: We got the proofs back from that photo shoot, you know, the one with the little vegetables. Anyway, they pretty much sucked, so, I blew off the rest of the day, and I went shopping…(looks through her bags)… and I got you, I’m looking, I’m looking, I’m looking, I got you…
(Chandler sees Phoebe breaking up with Tony. She talks to him for a few seconds, hugs him, and then he leaves. Chandler is amazed how easy it was for her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What… did you get me there?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I got you…these. (pulls out a pair of socks)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bullwinkle socks. That’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well, I knew you had the Rockys, and so I figured, you know, you can wear Bullwinkle and Bullwinkle, or you can wear Rocky and Rocky,or, you can mix and match, moose and squirrel. Whatever you want.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great.
(The drinks arrive, and Chandler downs his espresso in one gulp.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m gonna get another espresso. Can I get you another latte?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No, no, I’m still working on mine.
(Chandler walks over to the counter where Phoebe is, and is asking her about the break-up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it was really hard.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, that hug looked pretty brutal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, you weren’t there.

content.description: The Launderama, Rachel is there, waiting for Ross. An old woman takes Rachel’s clothes off the machine and begins loading it with her things.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Comin’ through. Move, move.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, ’scuse me. I was kinda using that machine.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Yeah, well, now you’re kinda not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I saved it. I put my basket on top.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, is that your basket? It’s really pretty. Unfortunately, I don’t see suds.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: No suds, no save. Ok?
(Ross arrives.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, uh, nothing. That horrible woman just took my machine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Was your basket on top?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but, there were no suds.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you know, no suds, no save.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No suds? Excuse me, hold on a second. (to woman) That’s my friend’s machine.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hey, hey, hey, her stuff wasn’t in it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, hey, that’s not the rule and you know it.
(The woman and Ross stare at each other. Finally she takes her stuff out of the machine and leaves.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, show’s over. Nothing to see here. (to Rachel) Ok, let’s do laundry.
content.parenthetical: to the crowd in the laundromat

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That was amazing. I can’t even send back soup.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, that’s because you’re such a sweet, gentle, uh…Do you, uh, do you…Oh, hey, uh you must need detergent.
(Ross pulls out a huge box of laundry detergent.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uberveiss . It’s new, it’s German, it’s extra-tough.
(Rachel starts to load her clothes.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, do you uh, are you gonna separate those?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh god. Oh, am I being like a total laundry spaz? I mean, am I supposed to use like one machine for shirts and another machine for pants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, have you never done this before?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, not myself, but I know other people that have. Ok, you caught me. I’m a laundry virgin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, well, don’t worry, I’ll use the gentle cycle. Ok, um, basically you wanna use one machine for all your whites, a whole nother machine for colors, and a third for your uh, your uh, delicates, and that would be your bras and your under-panty things.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Well, what about these are white cotton panties. Would they go with whites or delicates?
content.parenthetical: holds a pair of panties in front of Ross

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, that, that, that would be a judgment call.

content.description: Fancy restaurant, Monica, Joey, Angela, and Bob are seated at the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He is so cute. (to Angela and Bob) So, where did you guys grow up?

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Brooklyn Heights.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Cleveland.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How, how did that happen?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I suddenly had the feeling that I was falling. But I’m not.

content.description: Fancy restaurant, Joey and Bob are talking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you and Angela, huh?

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Yep. Pretty much.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re a lucky man. You know what I miss the most about her? That cute nibbly noise when she eats. Like a happy little squirrel, or a weasel.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Huh, I never really noticed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, yeah, listen for it.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Monica, Monica is great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but it’s not gonna last. She’s too much for me in bed. Sexually.

content.description: The ladies’ bathroom at the restaurant, Monica and Angela are talking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve gotta tell you, Bob is terrific.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Yeah, isn’t he?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is so great to meet a guy who is smart and funny, and has an emotional age beyond, like eight.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: You know what else? He’s unbelievable in bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. My brother never even told me when he lost his virginity.

content.speaker: Angela
content.text: Huh. That’s nice.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is coaching Chandler on how to break up with Janice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, you can do this. It’s just like pulling off a Band-aid. Just do it really fast, and then the wound is exposed.
(Chandler walks back to couch, where Janice is.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice. Hi, Janice. Ok, here we go. I don’t think we should go out anymore. Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: All right. Well, there you go. (she gets extremely wound up, and begins to try and calm herself down) Stop it, stop it, stop it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I know this is gonna sound really stupid, but I feel that if I can do this, you know, if I can actually do my own laundry, there isn’t anything I can’t do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That does not sound stupid to me. You know, it’s like the first time I had to make dinner for myself, after Carol left me? (the buzzer on the washer goes off) I’m sorry, that’s all the time we have. Next on Ross…(opens up the washer) Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What uh-oh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-oh, uh-oh, the laundry’s done. It’s, uh, it’s a song. The laundry song that we sing. (singing) Uh-oh the laundry’s done, uh-oh, uh-oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing, nothing. Lee-lo, the laundry’s done.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, show me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, all right, it’s just that you left a red sock in with all your whites, and now, everything’s kinda pink.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, everything’s pink.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, uh, except for the red sock, which is still red. I’m sorry, please don’t be upset, it could happen to anyone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Except it didn’t. It happened to me. Oh, god, I’m gonna look like a big marshmallow peep. What am I doing? What am I doing? My father’s right. I can’t live on my own! I can’t even do laundry!
(The woman who had tried to steal the washing machine walks by, and laughs.)

content.description: The fancy restaurant, Angela has her hand in Bob’s shirt, and Monica is very uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Something went wrong with Underdog, and they couldn’t get his head to inflate. So anyway, um, his head is like flopping down Broadway, right, and I’m just thinking… how inappropriate this is. Um, I’ve got something in my eye, uh, Joey, could we check it in the light, please?
(Her and Joey walk away from the table.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello! Were we at the same table? It’s like… cocktails in Appalachia.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, they’re close.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Close? She’s got her tongue in his ear.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, like you’ve never gotten a little rambunctious with Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, this is sick, it’s disgusting, it’s, it’s—not really true, is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, who’s to say what’s true? I mean…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, what were you thinking?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, look, I’m not proud of this, ok? Well, maybe I am a little.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m outta here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait, wait, wait. You want him, I want her. He likes you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I’m thinking, if we put our heads together, between the two of us, we can break them up.
[Time lapse, Monica accidentally spilled her drink on Bob’s shirt and is wiping it off. Joey is making eyes at Angela.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so sorry, I can’t believe I did this, but I couldn’t stop laughing at your Norman Mailer story.
(Angela is eating chicken wings and making the weasel-like noise Joey had told Bob about.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, waiter, one more plate of chicken wings over here.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is still trying to ease things over with Janice, and there are about a dozen empty Espresso cups in front of him. He is extremely wired.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here’s the thing, Janice. You know, I mean, it’s like we’re different. I’m like the bing, bing, bing. You’re like the boom, boom, (Chandler flails his hand out and hits Janice in the eye)… boom.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, my god, I’m so sorry. Are you ok?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ow. Um, it’s just my lens. It’s just my lens. I’ll be right back.
(She leaves.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hit her in the eye! I hit her in the eye! This is the worst break-up in the history of the world.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my god. (Chandler downs another espresso.) How many of those have you had?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I don’t know, a million?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, easy, easy. Go to your happy place. La la la la la la la.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right.
(Janice returns from the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not fine. Here she comes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait here. Breathe.
(Phoebe goes over to speak to Janice. She talks to her for a few seconds, and then Janice immediately smiles, hugs her, waves to Chandler, and leaves.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do you do that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s like a gift.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We should always always break up together.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’d like that.

content.description: The Launderama. Rachel is sorting her now-pink clothes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got the clothes clean. Now that’s the important part.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I guess. Except everything looks like jammies now.
(The same woman walks over and takes Rachel’s laundry cart.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa, I’m sorry. Excuse me. We had this cart.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Yeah, well, I had a 24-inch waist. You lose things. Now come on, get outta my way.
(Rachel looks at Ross, who motions to her to get the cart back.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, you know, maybe I wasn’t being clear. Uh, this is our cart.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hey, hey, hey there aren’t any clothes in it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, quit making up rules!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Let go!
(They struggle for the cart. Finally, Rachel climbs inside of it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, listen, missy. If you want this cart, you’re gonna have to take me with it!
(She thinks it over, and then walks away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Did you see that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were incredible! Brand new woman, ladies and gentlemen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I could not have done this without you.
(Rachel stands up and kisses Ross. He is stunned. A moment of silence follows.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, um, uh, more clothes in the dryer? (Ross turns and bangs his head on an open dryer door.) I’m fine, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Ross has an icepack to his head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, are you sure you’re ok?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does it still hurt?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What a neat idea. All your clothes match. I’m gonna do this.
(Monica and Joey enter.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, how’d it go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We ripped that couple apart, and kept the pieces for ourselves.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What a beautiful story. Hey, I’m fine by the way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where’s Chandler?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, he needed some time to grieve.
(Chandler runs by the window outside, joyous.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m free! I’m free!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That oughta do it.
